website_summaries.verdict: A significant number of runners agreed that the Altra Vanish-R was comfortable and responsive. They were contented with the footwear's lightweight structure and perfect fit. Although several of the users have issues with its thin tongue unit, others still recommend the shoe because of its flexibility. Overall, a lot of the users are satisfied and happy because of the Altra Vanish-R's excellent performance.
pros: According to some purchasers, the footwear was lightweight in structure
A good number of buyers noted that the fit was perfect
Several wearers admired the Altra Vanish-R's flexibility
Many testers agreed that the shoe was responsive
A handful of runners said that the footwear was comfortable
Several consumers noted that the upper unit of the Altra Vanish-R offered a glove-like fit
Gaining control and feeling the ground beneath the sole unit was a satisfying aspect, several users observed
cons: Some runners observed that the tongue unit was too thin
One of the buyers said that the Altra Vanish-R is not durable

customer_reviews.title: Not that Light
customer_reviews.text: These literally fit like a glove. Tight and snug. Definitely get half a size larger. They run small. I got these because they are supposedly the lightest running shoes around and should feel like running barefoot but I just don’t feel the lightness. I usually wear canvas Keds and that could be the reason because canvas sneakers are already light and not to mention much cheaper. I also feel these won’t last long because the material is so thin. Anyway will update review if they prove me wrong but for now only 2 stars because I’m just not impressed with the lightness.
customer_reviews.author: dasn0wman

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow where the foot widens.  Not a practical shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Who in the world is designing this shoe? Take an average foot, ink it up, and then look at the print it makes on a piece of paper -- what's so hard about seeing how a foot is shaped? One review suggested that these might be the shoes for the China market and their feet are slimmer for any given size. I'm skeptical of that. It's too bad because I really liked the shoe. I purchased here on Amazon so sending back will not be too much trouble.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Reviews

customer_reviews.title: The shoe looks great but it runs way too small
customer_reviews.text: The shoe looks great but it runs way too small. I run in 11.5 which is a size bigger than normal shoe. I got these in 12 and they do not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Pena

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try out this new design with the accommodating toe box. Unfortunately the shoe is smaller than a normal fit. I ordered my normal size and my toes were jammed up against front of toe box. Return RMA was quick and easy. I'll order a larger size and retry - follow up with a new review based on new size. Update: Return was acknowledge quickly via email after sending via UPS. I went ahead and ordered a size up to try even though funds have not been returned (a couple business days they say).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Crutchfield

customer_reviews.title: NARROW
customer_reviews.text: 1) either I have absurdly wide feet or these shoes are extremely narrow. The only way I can wear these shoes is without socks. 2) there are 2 sets of insoles that change the fit of the shoe dramatically. 3) I wore them for one four mile run and they are already showing wear. 4) they are extremely light which is great. The shoes have potential but don’t buy the shoes if you might have wide feet. Also I don’t see the shoes making it to 100 miles. I will update as I wear them more though.
customer_reviews.author: King shi tzu

customer_reviews.title: Wrong photo used- "yellow" is really bright pink!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the yellow shoes for my husband for his birthday. He received bright pink shoes. When I checked the item listing to see if I maybe selected the wrong color, I see that there isn't even bright pink option. My history shows that I did indeed order the "yellow" shoe but the picture displayed was wrong- both the yellow and grey/lime options have the same photo. I googled the "yellow" and it turns out the shoe is actually bright pink. Inaccurate description and wrong display picture. We are returning. Please update your listing!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: For starters, I got the red pair, and even though the listing says they are a men’s running shoes, the pair I received were women’s shoes. They even say Fit 4 women on the box. That’s frustrating to start, but I decided to try them out anyways. Even though they sent me the right size in men’s. These shoes are a bit tight, but once I took one of the insoles out they fit way better. Overall, I would not recommend these shoes. I would return the pair I got, but I already ran over 10kms in them. So I guess I’m stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be comfortable in these shoes. I tried to make these my replacements after a barefoot shoe but these hurt my feet. I did 5ks, short sprints and casual wear but the shoes never got more comfortable. I didn't realize it at first but whenever I put the shoes on and started walking the outside of my right foot would start aching. Now there sitting collecting dust while I use my old shoes to run in.
customer_reviews.author: RBG Family

customer_reviews.title: These shoes almost seem like they misprinted the label
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a problem buying shoes before. 11.5 is my size and it always works. Some shoes are slightly bigger, some a little smaller, but 11.5 has always worked. These shoes almost seem like they misprinted the label. They're easily a size to a size and a half too small. Pretty disappointed because I was gonna use them for a training run today. Paid the overnight shipping and everything.
customer_reviews.author: laplans

customer_reviews.title: Cool show overall - just didnt work
customer_reviews.text: Loved the idea of an Altra with a stiffer sole for speed work - found that the arch support was killing me though - I wish they'd kept the inside flat as with the Solstice and it would have been perfect. I cant really wear them for more than an hour or two or my knees start hurting, but I've spent many many hours in their other shoes and love them. Great shoe...almost.
customer_reviews.author: Arash Ranjbaran

customer_reviews.title: Buying shoes online is not a walk-in-the-park.
customer_reviews.text: It's challenging to rely on reviews, including this one. I sized up on this shoe due to reviews stating "too small." My normal (if there is such a thing as normal)... size is 7.5, so I ordered a size 8, which was too small as well. I returned them. That aside, they are a stylish looking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Robert De Cicco

customer_reviews.title: Love Altra brand but these weren’t for me
customer_reviews.text: These were lightweight as promised, however they ran large and the material was thinner than I expected. It was more like a mesh upper. I think these would be good for someone with a bigger foot than I have (baby feet over here) and also someone who’s a bit lighter on their feet than I am.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk shoe, huge Altra fan (its all i run) but this shoe is a waste. Why cant they just put a road sole on the XC ?? Save your money and yes FULL size small
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good ground feel and responsiveness
customer_reviews.text: Super light. The ground feel is good. The responsiveness is good also may be due to the propel plate. After a few break in, I feel ok. The upper is flexible enough to let toes moving freely. One minor drawback is that the tongue is too thin, therefore the shoe lace make my top foot not so comfy somettimes
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Color wrong and shoe is very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is very flimsy with zero support for your foot, they are more coral color than a bright pink, a bit small so if you order this shoe add a half a size bigger. I sent these back because the color was not what I wanted and the shoe was WAY to flimsy
customer_reviews.author: Shellie Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as MT Kings
customer_reviews.text: I have Altra MTs and they fit great. These fit very strangely. Tight at the bottom of the laces across the top of foot. They seem to make my knees cave in a bit. I'll stick to my other Altras
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGurl

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is impossible
customer_reviews.text: The toe box is too short and my toe nail was pushing through the upper. I'll spare you the pictures of my toenail after 6 miles of hill work 2 stars, cause it is super light. Just have to order at least a full size up.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D Bevilacqua

customer_reviews.title: Cure for runners knee
customer_reviews.text: Haven't ran in 5years and would always get runners knee (had nike shoes with wedged heel) after 0.5 miles stopping my workout. 1st day with new shoes able to run 1.5miles without any discomfort. Only con is blisters forming over my heel but that's way better than suffering through runners knee.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller toe box than previous Altras
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and bunions. I have used Altra one 2.5 before with enough room in the toe box to accommodate my feet. These shoes were much too narrow, even with a half size larger. They also are more suitable for low volume feet. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist running shoe convert!
customer_reviews.text: Altra shoes have helped tremendously with my chronic hip pain both during and after my run has ended. I don’t feel pain the next day as compared to running in Nike, Brooks, and ASICS. I have recently bought into the minimalist running shoe theory. Won’t run on a treadmill with a thicker soled shoe ever again. Trying to keep the Orthopaedic surgeon away. Haven’t run outside or bare foot, yet.
customer_reviews.author: KW 40+ y/o

customer_reviews.title: Altra Vanish-R
customer_reviews.text: It took 3 tries to get the right fit. Much smaller than expected. I ordered true to size then went up a half size. The final solution was a full size larger than my usual shoe size. I am enjoying them now, light and offers a good feel to mother earth.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT A. ROSENFELD, D.D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Light, but crazy small. Like a size and a half small:)
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, get light, but very, very, very, very, very, very, very small. Feels like a 7.5 instead of the 9 I supposedly got. Even checked the box and label in the shoe to check if it was a mistake. Also didn't feel quite neutral. Bummer. I have a 3 year old torin which I love, but lately altras feel tight compared to mine.
customer_reviews.author: Bellows Water

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: I will add that they run very small. I’m usually a 9-9.5 but for these I ended up purchasing a 10.5. With that being said the shoes are great, extremely comfortable, and I love the light weight minimalist feel.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Light and fast!
customer_reviews.text: Lightest shows i ever worn. It's made small, had to exchange a half size bigger. It works fine with thin socks but I will definitely order Full size bigger next time. I have run up 7 miles so far, my feet feels very light and fast.
customer_reviews.author: klee

customer_reviews.title: Order a full size bigger
customer_reviews.text: This runs so small. Son is a 7.5 so I ordered an 8 yet he can’t even get his foot in the sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Good part, light
customer_reviews.text: Good part, light, easy to dry. Things need to improved, 1) not wide foot friendly 2) it's good two pairs of insoles. One is light and good. Another normal one is too thick and two wide for this slimming designed Vanish R.
customer_reviews.author: Qiyang

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These shoes didn’t last 2 weeks and they were falling apart. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Nauert

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Had to return because didn't fit would recommend a size up if choosing this shoes
customer_reviews.author: Rachel L kuebler

customer_reviews.title: Like the shoe until the side blew out 3 weeks after receiving it
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is very lightweight and I really did like the shoe but 3 weeks after buying it the side blew out and a seem started ripping. I don't
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Nutting

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: While definitely designed to be worn without a sock, it was still sized a bit small.
customer_reviews.author: peter sgouros

customer_reviews.title: Very light! Great for minimalists
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes! The only minor gripe I have is that my Garmin Footpod would run against the top of my foot and cause it to rub a little raw.
customer_reviews.author: Zia

customer_reviews.title: Fits better without the insoles
customer_reviews.text: Fits better without the insoles, it is tight across the bridge of foot. Love the space around the toes. Probably fits someone that is slightly flat footed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size larger for my son. Runs everyday on gym track .....
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Great brand.
customer_reviews.text: Great brand, but these fit waaaaaay smaller that the previous shoes i had bought from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I've followed the size chart and sent a e-mail to Altra. The suggest size 9. Even without insoles they are tight. I've lost 100 dollares ....I wonder if I could return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: gender specific?
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as a men’s shoe and the tag says “fit for her” Which is it?
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Altra shoes tend to run a little small.
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe but were about a half size too small. This is a minimal racing flat so they really need to fit properly because there is very little support.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Tight around my foot
customer_reviews.text: I Liked the shoe but it was to tight around my foot
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Rosales

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I returned it... for way too tight and easy to thin for me
customer_reviews.author: lucia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super light. You don't even know its on your foot.
customer_reviews.author: trail-runner

product_meta.title: ALTRA Men's Vanish-R Sneaker, Red, 7.5
product_meta.description: Altra’s first true racing flat is here! The Vanish-R is extremely lightweight and flexible for a great fit and feel. The lightweight, breathable mesh upper will keep you dry and comfortable while the Propel Plate™ push-off feature in the midsole will help you spring forward with more power. If you’ve been looking for a FootShape™ racing flat, look no further. The Altra Vanish-R is sure to impress.
